item.title: CrossFit Friday
item.description: CrossFit in the Activity Center gym taught by Nick Petterssen and Cady Hart of The Confluence in Montpelier. This program is open to all levels. Craftsbury guests are free, $5/session for Craftsbury Members, $10 all others. Read more.

item.description: Want to work out on your own? After you have your annual membership, Open Gym passes are $50/person per season. Must be 18 or older to use the gym independently. Full details.

item.title: Saturday Morning Yoga
item.description: Saturday morning yoga with Martha Jayne Keglor, Cedar Multi-purpose room. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. While yoga mats, blocks and straps are available, please bring your own if you have them.

item.title: ErgSpin Sunday
item.description: When in Rome, you eat gelato and visit the Colosseum. When in the vicinity of Morrisville, VT, home of Concept2, you hop on an erg! Join us for an invigorating class for all abilities on either the rowing machines or SkiErgs led by one of our world class GRP athletes. More info

item.title: Sunday Saunters
item.description: These Sunday saunters are a way for the greater Craftsbury community to get together for some fun running! We'll provide a number of routes each week - you choose your running companions, speed, and distance! Starting locations will rotate through surrounding towns, with meet-up spots such as the Outdoor Center, Craftsbury Village, Willey's, Lake Eligo, East Albany, etc. Email running director Heidi Caldwell at heidi.caldwell@craftsbury.com to get on the email list for the weekly update!

item.title: Yoga Sunday
item.description:
Come join our Community Yoga classes for a good stretch!

Sundays at 10:30-11:30am are led by Margaret Pitkin. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. While yoga mats, blocks and straps are available, please bring your own if you have them.

item.title: Open Gym
item.description: Want to work out on your own? After you have your annual membership, Open Gym passes are $50/person per season. Must be 18 or older to use the gym independently. Full details.

item.description: Want to work out on your own? After you have your annual membership, Open Gym passes are $50/person per season. Must be 18 or older to use the gym independently. Full details.

item.title: Chair Yoga
item.description: Chair Yoga with Liz Keglor. Come try this new offering at COC. All abilities are welcome. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. Mondays 4:00-5:00pm in the Multi-purpose room in Cedar Lodge. More details.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Community Fitness
item.description: Looking for an energetic and fun workout group? Come to community fitness! It's a well-rounded class developed to improve balance, strength, and coordination through circuit style training. The workouts can accommodate people of all levels and are led by members of our Green Racing Project. Mondays in Activity Center, Wednesdays in Cedar. Class is free for house guests, $5 for members, and $10 for visitors to the Center. Read more.

item.title: CrossFit Tuesday
item.description: CrossFit in the Activity Center gym taught by Nick Petterssen and Cady Hart of The Confluence in Montpelier. This program is open to all levels. Craftsbury guests are free, $5/session for Craftsbury Members, $10 all others. Read more.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Tuesday Race Series
item.description: Looking for a low-key way to test your summer fitness? Starting May 28th, our weekly trail series offers a 5k run and 5 or 10k bike race every Tuesday, for only $5/race or $30 for the entire series - annual members and houseguests race for free! Registration online, bib pickup and day-of reg open at 5:15pm in the Activity Center. Race start is in the upper soccer field by the white tent with bikers at 5:45pm and runners at 6pm. Full details here.

item.title: Feldenkrais Wednesday
item.description: Would you like to move, work, play, and compete with more ease, comfort, efficiency and strength? Then join resident massage therapist Kimberly Howell for a Feldenkrais Awareness Through Movement (ATM) class at the Craftsbury Outdoor Center. Classes are in the Cedar Multi-room. Pay for the class with your COC Punch Card or cash. $5 for Members, $10 for Visitors, and Free for Overnight Guests. Read more. Wednesday at 4:30pm.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Community Fitness
item.description: Looking for an energetic and fun workout group? Come to community fitness! It's a well-rounded class developed to improve balance, strength, and coordination through circuit style training. The workouts can accommodate people of all levels and are led by members of our Green Racing Project. Mondays in Activity Center, Wednesdays in Cedar. Class is free for house guests, $5 for members, and $10 for visitors to the Center. Read more.

item.title: Community Strength
item.description: Community Strength is focused on getting you the full-body strength workout you need for holistic fitness. This class will begin with an introduction to the fundamentals of weightlifting. Similar to Community Fitness on Mondays, this class will use circuit-style training to help you improve balance, strength, and coordination. Workouts can accommodate people of all levels and are led by members of our Green Racing Project on Wednesdays in the Cedar Multipurpose Room. Class is free for house guests, $5 for members, and $10 for visitors to the Center.

item.title: Yoga Thursday
item.description: Come join our Community Yoga classes for a good stretch! Thursdays at 4:30-5:30pm are led by Liz Keglor. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. While yoga mats, blocks and straps are available, please bring your own if you have them.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Community Track Practice
item.description: Join the Craftsbury Outdoor Center Running Program for a community track workout at the Morrisville Track on Thursday evenings. Track workouts can be a fun and motivating way to begin an individual running routine, learn more about training, and boost aerobic capacity. This program is a community outlet for ALL and encourages walking and running alike, emphasizing not speed but rather the shared effort of getting out and moving. Full details here.

item.description: Join us this July 28-August 2 for our inaugural Biathlon Camp for HS Athletes. A five-day overnight camp biathlon camp designed for high school athletes ages 15-18 with beginner or intermediate biathlon experience, though no experience is necessary. Details

item.title: ErgSpin Sunday
item.description: When in Rome, you eat gelato and visit the Colosseum. When in the vicinity of Morrisville, VT, home of Concept2, you hop on an erg! Join us for an invigorating class for all abilities on either the rowing machines or SkiErgs led by one of our world class GRP athletes. More info

item.title: Sunday Saunters
item.description: These Sunday saunters are a way for the greater Craftsbury community to get together for some fun running! We'll provide a number of routes each week - you choose your running companions, speed, and distance! Starting locations will rotate through surrounding towns, with meet-up spots such as the Outdoor Center, Craftsbury Village, Willey's, Lake Eligo, East Albany, etc. Email running director Heidi Caldwell at heidi.caldwell@craftsbury.com to get on the email list for the weekly update!

item.title: Yoga Sunday
item.description:
Come join our Community Yoga classes for a good stretch!

Sundays at 10:30-11:30am are led by Margaret Pitkin. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. While yoga mats, blocks and straps are available, please bring your own if you have them.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Community Fitness
item.description: Looking for an energetic and fun workout group? Come to community fitness! It's a well-rounded class developed to improve balance, strength, and coordination through circuit style training. The workouts can accommodate people of all levels and are led by members of our Green Racing Project. Mondays in Activity Center, Wednesdays in Cedar. Class is free for house guests, $5 for members, and $10 for visitors to the Center. Read more.

item.title: CrossFit Tuesday
item.description: CrossFit in the Activity Center gym taught by Nick Petterssen and Cady Hart of The Confluence in Montpelier. This program is open to all levels. Craftsbury guests are free, $5/session for Craftsbury Members, $10 all others. Read more.

item.title: Tuesday Race Series
item.description: Looking for a low-key way to test your summer fitness? Starting May 28th, our weekly trail series offers a 5k run and 5 or 10k bike race every Tuesday, for only $5/race or $30 for the entire series - annual members and houseguests race for free! Registration online, bib pickup and day-of reg open at 5:15pm in the Activity Center. Race start is in the upper soccer field by the white tent with bikers at 5:45pm and runners at 6pm. Full details here.

item.title: Feldenkrais Wednesday
item.description: Would you like to move, work, play, and compete with more ease, comfort, efficiency and strength? Then join resident massage therapist Kimberly Howell for a Feldenkrais Awareness Through Movement (ATM) class at the Craftsbury Outdoor Center. Classes are in the Cedar Multi-room. Pay for the class with your COC Punch Card or cash. $5 for Members, $10 for Visitors, and Free for Overnight Guests. Read more. Wednesday at 4:30pm.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. item.title: Community Fitness
item.description: Looking for an energetic and fun workout group? Come to community fitness! The workouts can accommodate people of all levels and are led by members of our Green Racing Project. Mondays in Activity Center, Wednesdays in Cedar. Class is free for house guests, $5 for members, and $10 for visitors to the Center. Read more.

item.title: Community Strength
item.description: Community Strength is focused on getting you the full-body strength workout you need for holistic fitness. This class will begin with an introduction to the fundamentals of weightlifting. Similar to Community Fitness on Mondays, this class will use circuit-style training to help you improve balance, strength, and coordination. Workouts can accommodate people of all levels and are led by members of our Green Racing Project on Wednesdays in the Cedar Multipurpose Room. Class is free for house guests, $5 for members, and $10 for visitors to the Center.

item.title: Yoga Thursday
item.description: Come join our Community Yoga classes for a good stretch! Thursdays at 4:30-5:30pm are led by Liz Keglor. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. While yoga mats, blocks and straps are available, please bring your own if you have them.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Community Track Practice
item.description: Join the Craftsbury Outdoor Center Running Program for a community track workout at the Morrisville Track on Thursday evenings. Track workouts can be a fun and motivating way to begin an individual running routine, learn more about training, and boost aerobic capacity. This program is a community outlet for ALL and encourages walking and running alike, emphasizing not speed but rather the shared effort of getting out and moving. Full details here.

item.description: Summer training camp for high school runners of all abilities. More info here.

item.title: Open Gym
item.description: Want to work out on your own? After you have your annual membership, Open Gym passes are $50/person per season. Must be 18 or older to use the gym independently. Full details.

item.title: Chair Yoga
item.description: Chair Yoga with Liz Keglor. Come try this new offering at COC. All abilities are welcome. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. Mondays 4:00-5:00pm in the Multi-purpose room in Cedar Lodge. More details.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Community Fitness
item.description: Looking for an energetic and fun workout group? Come to community fitness! It's a well-rounded class developed to improve balance, strength, and coordination through circuit style training. The workouts can accommodate people of all levels and are led by members of our Green Racing Project. Mondays in Activity Center, Wednesdays in Cedar. Class is free for house guests, $5 for members, and $10 for visitors to the Center. Read more.

item.title: CrossFit Tuesday
item.description: CrossFit in the Activity Center gym taught by Nick Petterssen and Cady Hart of The Confluence in Montpelier. This program is open to all levels. Craftsbury guests are free, $5/session for Craftsbury Members, $10 all others. Read more.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Tuesday Race Series
item.description: Looking for a low-key way to test your summer fitness? Starting May 28th, our weekly trail series offers a 5k run and 5 or 10k bike race every Tuesday, for only $5/race or $30 for the entire series - annual members and houseguests race for free! Registration online, bib pickup and day-of reg open at 5:15pm in the Activity Center. Race start is in the upper soccer field by the white tent with bikers at 5:45pm and runners at 6pm. Full details here.

item.title: Open Gym
item.description: Want to work out on your own? After you have your annual membership, Open Gym passes are $50/person per season. Must be 18 or older to use the gym independently. Full details.

item.title: Open Gym
item.description: Want to work out on your own? After you have your annual membership, Open Gym passes are $50/person per season. Must be 18 or older to use the gym independently. Full details.

item.title: Feldenkrais Wednesday
item.description: Would you like to move, work, play, and compete with more ease, comfort, efficiency and strength? Then join resident massage therapist Kimberly Howell for a Feldenkrais Awareness Through Movement (ATM) class at the Craftsbury Outdoor Center. Classes are in the Cedar Multi-room. Pay for the class with your COC Punch Card or cash. $5 for Members, $10 for Visitors, and Free for Overnight Guests. Read more. Wednesday at 4:30pm.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Community Fitness
item.description: Looking for an energetic and fun workout group? Come to community fitness! It's a well-rounded class developed to improve balance, strength, and coordination through circuit style training. The workouts can accommodate people of all levels and are led by members of our Green Racing Project. Mondays in Activity Center, Wednesdays in Cedar. Class is free for house guests, $5 for members, and $10 for visitors to the Center. Read more.

item.title: Community Strength
item.description: Community Strength is focused on getting you the full-body strength workout you need for holistic fitness. This class will begin with an introduction to the fundamentals of weightlifting. Similar to Community Fitness on Mondays, this class will use circuit-style training to help you improve balance, strength, and coordination. Workouts can accommodate people of all levels and are led by members of our Green Racing Project on Wednesdays in the Cedar Multipurpose Room. Class is free for house guests, $5 for members, and $10 for visitors to the Center.

item.title: Yoga Thursday
item.description: Come join our Community Yoga classes for a good stretch! Thursdays at 4:30-5:30pm are led by Liz Keglor. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. While yoga mats, blocks and straps are available, please bring your own if you have them.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Community Track Practice
item.description: Join the Craftsbury Outdoor Center Running Program for a community track workout at the Morrisville Track on Thursday evenings. Track workouts can be a fun and motivating way to begin an individual running routine, learn more about training, and boost aerobic capacity. This program is a community outlet for ALL and encourages walking and running alike, emphasizing not speed but rather the shared effort of getting out and moving. Full details here.

item.title: ErgSpin Sunday
item.description: When in Rome, you eat gelato and visit the Colosseum. When in the vicinity of Morrisville, VT, home of Concept2, you hop on an erg! Join us for an invigorating class for all abilities on either the rowing machines or SkiErgs led by one of our world class GRP athletes. More info

item.title: Sunday Saunters
item.description: These Sunday saunters are a way for the greater Craftsbury community to get together for some fun running! We'll provide a number of routes each week - you choose your running companions, speed, and distance! Starting locations will rotate through surrounding towns, with meet-up spots such as the Outdoor Center, Craftsbury Village, Willey's, Lake Eligo, East Albany, etc. Email running director Heidi Caldwell at heidi.caldwell@craftsbury.com to get on the email list for the weekly update!

item.title: Yoga Sunday
item.description:
Come join our Community Yoga classes for a good stretch!

Sundays at 10:30-11:30am are led by Margaret Pitkin. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. While yoga mats, blocks and straps are available, please bring your own if you have them.

Sundays at 10:30-11:30am are led by Margaret Pitkin. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. While yoga mats, blocks and straps are available, please bring your own if you have them.

item.title: Community Rowing
item.description: Hosmer Community Rowing (CommRow) runs four afternoons a week on Great Hosmer Pond, from mid-May through the end of September. Whether you're an experienced sculler or have never been in a boat before, Craftsbury Outdoor Center staff and Green Racing Project athletes will be on hand to help you take the next step. Get all the details.

item.title: Feldenkrais Wednesday
item.description: Would you like to move, work, play, and compete with more ease, comfort, efficiency and strength? Then join resident massage therapist Kimberly Howell for a Feldenkrais Awareness Through Movement (ATM) class at the Craftsbury Outdoor Center. Classes are in the Cedar Multi-room. Pay for the class with your COC Punch Card or cash. $5 for Members, $10 for Visitors, and Free for Overnight Guests. Read more. Wednesday at 4:30pm.

item.title: Sep. 19 — 22, 2019 : Trails2Ales Running Camp
item.description: Northern Vermont is home to some of New England's (and arguably the world's) best craft breweries and trail networks, so why not take a long weekend to enjoy both? More info here.

item.title: Community Track Practice
item.description: Join the Craftsbury Outdoor Center Running Program for a community track workout at the Morrisville Track on Thursday evenings. Track workouts can be a fun and motivating way to begin an individual running routine, learn more about training, and boost aerobic capacity. This program is a community outlet for ALL and encourages walking and running alike, emphasizing not speed but rather the shared effort of getting out and moving. Full details here.

item.title: Fri, Sep. 20, 2019 : Women's MTB Clinic
item.description: We're offering a series of free introductory/beginner mountain bike clinics & group rides for women. Clinics will focus on learning and honing mountain bike skills in a safe, supportive environment on the single track trails at the Outdoor Center. Read more

item.title: Sunday Saunters
item.description: These Sunday saunters are a way for the greater Craftsbury community to get together for some fun running! We'll provide a number of routes each week - you choose your running companions, speed, and distance! Starting locations will rotate through surrounding towns, with meet-up spots such as the Outdoor Center, Craftsbury Village, Willey's, Lake Eligo, East Albany, etc. Email running director Heidi Caldwell at heidi.caldwell@craftsbury.com to get on the email list for the weekly update!

item.title: Chair Yoga
item.description: Chair Yoga with Liz Keglor. Come try this new offering at COC. All abilities are welcome. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. Mondays 4:00-5:00pm in the Multi-purpose room in Cedar Lodge. More details.

item.title: Yoga Thursday
item.description: Come join our Community Yoga classes for a good stretch! Thursdays at 4:30-5:30pm are led by Liz Keglor. Yoga classes are free to all center staff and guests, $5/session for Craftsbury Outdoor Center members, and $10/session for all others. While yoga mats, blocks and straps are available, please bring your own if you have them.

item.title: Community Track Practice
item.description: Join the Craftsbury Outdoor Center Running Program for a community track workout at the Morrisville Track on Thursday evenings. Track workouts can be a fun and motivating way to begin an individual running routine, learn more about training, and boost aerobic capacity. This program is a community outlet for ALL and encourages walking and running alike, emphasizing not speed but rather the shared effort of getting out and moving. Full details here.

item.title: Jan. 2 — 5, 2020 : Skiing for Runners
item.description: Four days of cross-training and instruction. Join the pack of runners who've learned the secrets to moving thru the winter landscape! Details.

item.title: Jan. 2 — 5, 2020 : Skiing for Scullers
item.description: Craftsbury in winter is just as spectacular as Craftsbury in summer, with the focus shifted to Nordic skiing. Following the same formula you know from sculling camps, we'll teach you how to ski (or how to improve your skiing) and how skiing will benefit your sculling next summer. Drills, video, training talks, a low student-to-coach ratio, our usual delicious food, and more will fill your weekend as you learn from our sculling staff who have become proficient skiers, as well as our full-time skiing staff. Full Details.
